Hi,

On 2/19/07, Jeff Clune <jclune@...> wrote:

>
> Kurzweil thinks this is going to be the key to AI...reverse engineering the
> brain (as opposed to engineering different AI or evolving it).
>
> You guys agree? I think we'll evolve AI before we reverse engineer the brain
> sufficiently to pass the Turing test. Well, I actually think that all of
> these different methods will continue to cross fertilize each other such
> that no individual thrust will be solely responsible.

Yeh but history rarely remembers the people behind the breakthroughs,
only the people who took the last step. The major barriers are still
hardware ones (essentially limits in available computational
resources) and once those problems are solved (by chemists,
physicists, mathematicians, etc. working on CPU fabrication and
design), actually putting together an artificial conciousness could
quite possibly be a fairly straighforward exercise.

Anyway for further reading see the wikipedia "technological
singularity "article, featuring a rather nifty 'big picture' graph of
technological progress:

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Technological_singularity


Colin
